intro: Bromus steudelii, commonly known as the Steudel's brome, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and typically grows in temperate climates. The plant has slender, erect stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green color. Bromus steudelii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
